headline: What Charter Communications (CHTR)'s Internet Subscriber Loss and Mobile Growth Mean For Shareholders
summary: Charter Communications reported its third quarter 2025 earnings, revealing a 1% year-over-year drop in revenue to US$13.67 billion and a decline of 109,000 internet customers, alongside an addition of 493,000 mobile lines. While internet subscriber losses weighed on results, continued growth in Charter's mobile segment and ongoing network upgrades highlighted the company's shifting focus within its connectivity offerings. We’ll now explore how subscriber declines and shifting segment growth...

headline: Charter Communications (CHTR): Margin Gains Outpace Narrative as Profit Growth Exceeds Five-Year Average
summary: Charter Communications (CHTR) delivered annual profit growth of 13.2%, outpacing its five-year average of 7.1% per year, with net profit margins climbing to 9.5% from last year’s 8.5%. While revenue is forecast to grow at 1.3% per year and earnings by 4.2% per year, both below the US market averages, the company boasts a standout price-to-earnings ratio of 6.1x against industry and peer averages of 18.9x and 24.8x respectively. It is trading well below its estimated fair value at $233.84 per...
